summary: The document is a form detailing the investigation of David Reed Fromer, a person of interest in a DOD-affiliated personnel incident. It outlines his personal details, employment history, and legal interactions, highlighting his refusal to comply with procedural requirements such as executing DD Form 98, answering certain items, and being fingerprinted, based on legal advice to avoid self-incrimination. The document also mentions FBI reports related to Fromer from 1960 to 1966 and notes the legal support from his attorneys, Peter Franck and Vincent Hallinan.
key_findings: David Reed Fromer was investigated in relation to a DOD-affiliated personnel incident.
Fromer refused to execute DD Form 98, answer certain items, and be fingerprinted, citing legal advice.
The document references FBI reports on Fromer from 1960 to 1966.
Fromer's legal stance was supported by his attorneys, Peter Franck and Vincent Hallinan.
